questions.question: When you describe a picture, what is the first thing you should mention?
options: The small details in the corner

questions.question: The sentence 'The ball is red' describes the ball's ______.
The word 'large' in 'It is a large elephant' describes its ______.
The word 'round' in 'The sun is a round star' describes its ______.
The cat is sitting ______ the chair.
What is the boy doing in a picture if he is holding a book and looking at it?
Which word best describes the feel of a stone?
To describe a sunny day in a picture, you would use the word ______.
A tree has many green ______.
The girl has ______ hair.
The bird is flying ______ the house.
The fish is swimming ______ the water.
A person who is smiling in a picture probably feels ______.
The children are sitting ______ a tree.
What shape is a typical door?
To describe a tiger's coat, you would use the word ______.
The part of the picture that is closest to you is the ______.
The part of the picture that is farthest away is the ______.
A mountain is very ______.
The boy is sitting ______ his two friends.
A knife is a ______ object.
The main action in a picture of a race is ______.
The glass is full ______ water.
A picture of a birthday party would look ______.
The cat is ______ the mouse.
The moon is shining ______ in the sky.
An old house might look ______.
The children are wearing school ______.
The apple is red and ______.
The car is parked ______ the tree.
When you describe an object, what are the key things to mention?
The pillow feels ______. What word describes its texture?
The man in the picture looks old. He has ______ on his face.
A desert in a picture would have a lot of ______.
The water in a flowing river is not ______, it is moving.
If people in a picture are wearing sweaters and mufflers, the weather is probably ______.
The position of an object, like 'on the left' or 'on the right', helps to describe its ______.
The sky is full of ______ clouds, so it might rain.
The ______ man is working in the field.
The road in the mountains is very ______ with many turns.
A football has a ______ and ______ pattern.
In a picture of a busy market, you would see many ______.
A candle gives off a warm, yellow ______.
The train is moving on the ______.
The building in the city is very ______.
To describe an object, you should use ______ words.
A broken glass would have ______ edges.
The area behind the main objects in a picture is called the ______.
The doctor is checking a ______.
To start a description, you can say: 'This picture shows...'
When describing a picture, what does 'composition' refer to?
options: The colors used in the picture
The way objects are arranged in the picture
questions.correct_answer: The way objects are arranged in the picture

questions.question: The wooden table has a rough, grainy ______. What word best fits?
Which sentence uses more vivid and descriptive language?
options: The elderly man has a kind face with deep wrinkles.
questions.correct_answer: The elderly man has a kind face with deep wrinkles.

questions.question: What is the 'mood' or 'atmosphere' of a picture?
options: The main object in the picture
The overall feeling the picture creates
The colors used in the picture
questions.correct_answer: The overall feeling the picture creates

questions.question: A picture of a dark, stormy sea would likely have a ______ mood.
The vase is made of transparent ______, so you can see the water inside.
When you describe an object, what is meant by its 'function'?
options: Its purpose or what it is used for
questions.correct_answer: Its purpose or what it is used for

questions.question: The part of the picture between the foreground and the background is the ______.
Which of these is a good detail to mention when describing a person's expression?
options: The shape of their eyes and mouth
questions.correct_answer: The shape of their eyes and mouth

questions.question: What is a good way to structure a description?
options: Start with small details, then the main idea.
Describe things in a random order.
Start with a general overview, then move to specific details.
questions.correct_answer: Start with a general overview, then move to specific details.

questions.question: The light in the picture is dim and hazy. The time of day is probably ______ or ______.
Using sensory details means describing what you can see, hear, smell, taste, and ______.
The old book has yellow, ______ pages.
In a picture of a celebration, the atmosphere is likely to be ______.
The building is ______, with crumbling walls and broken windows.
What can you 'infer' from a picture?
options: Guess something based on the visual clues
Describe only what you can see
State the colors of the objects
Measure the size of the objects
questions.correct_answer: Guess something based on the visual clues

questions.question: If you see a picture of children with school bags walking away from a school building in the afternoon, you can infer that...
options: school has just finished for the day
the children are going to a party
questions.correct_answer: school has just finished for the day

questions.question: The knife has a ______ wooden handle and a sharp, metallic blade.
To describe an object in detail, you should mention its parts. A tree has a trunk, branches, and ______.
Which of these is a good detail for describing a busy city street?
options: The constant hum of traffic and chatter of people
questions.correct_answer: The constant hum of traffic and chatter of people

questions.question: The arrangement of light and shadow in a picture is called ______.
A room with neat furniture and everything in its place can be described as ______.
The ______ of the picture is a group of people having a picnic.
What is a good starting sentence for describing a picture?
options: 'The picture depicts a bustling market scene.'
'There are three colors in this picture.'
questions.correct_answer: 'The picture depicts a bustling market scene.'

questions.question: The old man's face shows a ______ expression, suggesting he is thinking deeply.
The ______ pattern on the butterfly's wings is beautiful.
Describing an object's 'origin' means telling...
In the ______ of the picture, we can see tall mountains.
The crowd is watching the cricket match with ______ excitement.
This is a ______ photo, not a color one.
Which sentence gives the most information about an object?
options: It is a big, brown, cardboard box.
questions.correct_answer: It is a big, brown, cardboard box.

questions.question: The path through the forest is narrow and ______.
From the clothes they are wearing, we can infer that the people in the picture belong to a ______.
A village scene might be described as ______, while a city scene is urban.
The river in the picture is calm and ______.
The artist has used ______ colors to create a happy mood.
A ______ of birds is flying across the sky.
The old fort is a magnificent historical ______.
When describing a picture, it's good to use prepositions of place to describe the ______ of objects.
The road is ______ with vehicles during rush hour.
What is the 'perspective' in a picture?
options: The point of view from which the picture is taken
questions.correct_answer: The point of view from which the picture is taken

questions.question: The scene is ______, with colorful flowers and green trees.
The water in the puddle is ______ the blue sky.
The child's face is full of ______ as he looks at the new toy.
A logical way to describe a scene is to move from...
options: left to right, or top to bottom
the smallest detail to the biggest
questions.correct_answer: left to right, or top to bottom

questions.question: The antique clock has an ______ design on its wooden case.
The mountain peaks are ______ in the distance.
What can you infer about the relationship between two people holding hands in a picture?
options: They are angry with each other.
They have a close and affectionate relationship.
questions.correct_answer: They have a close and affectionate relationship.

questions.question: The artist uses a ______ color palette to create a somber mood.
The clay pot is ______ and has a smooth, curved shape.
How does the artist's use of 'chiaroscuro' (strong contrast between light and dark) affect the mood of the picture?
options: It makes the picture feel flat and boring.
It creates a dramatic and mysterious atmosphere.
It makes the picture bright and cheerful.
It has no effect on the mood.
questions.correct_answer: It creates a dramatic and mysterious atmosphere.

questions.question: The worn-out pages and faded ink of the ancient manuscript ______ its great age.
Which simile best describes the old man's wrinkled face? 'His face was ______.'
options: like a roadmap of his life
questions.correct_answer: like a roadmap of his life

questions.question: The chaotic arrangement of objects in the room suggests that the occupant left in a ______.
The artist uses a low-angle perspective to make the main figure seem more ______.
What is the 'symbolism' of a dove in a picture?
options: It is just a bird with no other meaning.

questions.question: The ______ of the bright red flower against the dull grey background makes it the focal point.
The city skyline is ______ with skyscrapers of varying heights.
What can you infer about a room that is sparsely furnished and immaculately clean?
options: The owner is messy and disorganized.
The owner is a collector of many things.
The owner might be a minimalist or very disciplined.
The room is very old and derelict.
questions.correct_answer: The owner might be a minimalist or very disciplined.

questions.question: Which metaphor best describes a very busy market? 'The market was ______.'
The 'provenance' of an antique object refers to its...
The half-eaten meal on the table and the overturned chair ______ that something interrupted the scene abruptly.
A high-angle perspective, looking down on a subject, can make the subject seem...
The soft, diffused lighting in the portrait creates a ______ and dreamlike quality.
What is the primary message the artist might be conveying in a picture showing a single green sapling growing through cracked, barren concrete?
options: The resilience of nature and hope
questions.correct_answer: The resilience of nature and hope

questions.question: The use of 'leading lines' in a photograph's composition helps to...
options: draw the viewer's eye towards a specific point
questions.correct_answer: draw the viewer's eye towards a specific point

questions.question: The ______ smile on the politician's face seems insincere.
The 'rule of thirds' is a principle of composition that suggests placing key elements...
options: directly in the center of the picture
at the very edges of the picture
along imaginary lines that divide the picture into thirds
questions.correct_answer: along imaginary lines that divide the picture into thirds

questions.question: The once vibrant city is now a ______ of its former self, with empty streets and decaying buildings.
What can you infer from a picture of a single person standing on a vast, empty beach looking out at the ocean?
options: The person is at a crowded party.
The picture might evoke feelings of solitude or contemplation.
The person is afraid of water.
The picture is about the dangers of swimming alone.
questions.correct_answer: The picture might evoke feelings of solitude or contemplation.

questions.question: The ______ of the old photograph gives it a nostalgic feel.
The artist uses 'asymmetry' in the composition to create a sense of...
The dilapidated state of the playground ______ a lack of community funding or care.
Which metaphor best describes the feeling of a city at night? 'The city at night was ______.'
The 'patina' on an old bronze statue refers to the...
options: green or brown film on its surface produced by oxidation over a long period
questions.correct_answer: green or brown film on its surface produced by oxidation over a long period

questions.question: The 'body language' of the figures in the painting suggests a tense ______.
The ______ sky, painted in hues of orange and purple, indicates the sun has just set.
What is the likely theme of a picture showing a wealthy family dining lavishly while a poor child watches from outside a window?
The 'iconography' of a painting refers to the...
options: identification and interpretation of the subject matter and symbols
questions.correct_answer: identification and interpretation of the subject matter and symbols

questions.question: The soldier's ______ posture and grim expression convey the harsh realities of war.
The use of 'selective focus' in a photograph, where one object is sharp and the background is blurry, helps to...
The room is filled with ______ objects from around the world, suggesting the owner is a well-traveled person.
The 'ephemera' in a picture, like a ticket stub or a fading letter, can suggest themes of...
options: memory and the passage of time
questions.correct_answer: memory and the passage of time

questions.question: The artist's 'oeuvre' refers to...
options: the entire body of an artist's work
questions.correct_answer: the entire body of an artist's work

questions.question: The ______ light of dawn is beginning to illuminate the eastern sky.
The crumbling facade of the ancient temple is a testament to its ______.
The motion blur in the photograph of the racing car effectively conveys a sense of ______.
The ______ between the pristine garden and the decaying factory in the background creates a powerful social commentary.
The sparse, ______ landscape suggests a feeling of isolation and emptiness.
An 'allegorical' picture is one where...
options: the meaning is purely literal and direct
the characters and events symbolize abstract ideas or concepts
the picture is a perfect photograph of reality
questions.correct_answer: the characters and events symbolize abstract ideas or concepts

questions.question: The object's ______ design, with its clean lines and lack of ornamentation, is a hallmark of modernism.
The half-open door in the picture acts as a symbolic ______ to another world or a different future.
The ______ of the characters, with their backs turned to the viewer, creates a sense of mystery and intrigue.
The swirling, energetic brushstrokes give the painting a ______ quality.
The shadow of the prison bars falling across the man's face is a powerful ______ for his lack of freedom.
The 'mise-en-scène' of a photograph refers to...
options: the arrangement of everything within the frame (setting, props, lighting, figures)
the editing done after the photo was taken
questions.correct_answer: the arrangement of everything within the frame (setting, props, lighting, figures)

questions.question: The ______ of the child's bright red coat in an otherwise black-and-white scene is a deliberate artistic choice to draw attention.
A picture depicting an abandoned and overgrown city after a disaster would have a ______ mood.
The golden ratio is a principle of ______ thought to be aesthetically pleasing.
A critical description of an object goes beyond its physical properties to discuss its cultural or historical ______.
